description.value:
You take control of the air in a 100-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} that you can see within range. Choose one of the following effects when you cast the spell. The effect lasts for the spell’s duration, unless you use your action on a later turn to switch to a different effect. You can also use your action to temporarily halt the effect or to restart one you’ve halted.

Gusts. A wind picks up within the &Reference[cube]{cube}, continually blowing in a horizontal direction you designate. You choose the intensity of the wind: calm, moderate, or strong. If the wind is moderate or strong, ranged weapon attacks that enter or leave the &Reference[cube]{cube} or pass through it have disadvantage on their attack rolls. If the wind is strong, any creature moving against the wind must spend 1 extra foot of movement for each foot moved.

Downdraft. You cause a sustained blast of strong wind to blow downward from the top of the &Reference[cube]{cube}. Ranged weapon attacks that pass through the &Reference[cube]{cube} or that are made against targets within it have disadvantage on their attack rolls. A creature must make a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw if it flies into the &Reference[cube]{cube} for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there flying. On a failed save, the creature is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

Updraft. You cause a sustained updraft within the &Reference[cube]{cube}, rising upward from the cube’s bottom side. Creatures that end a fall within the &Reference[cube]{cube} take only half damage from the fall. When a creature in the &Reference[cube]{cube} makes a vertical jump, the creature can jump up to 10 feet higher than normal.
